Threat: Nature: Server rendered useless, e.g.\ by hardware failure or natural disaster
Countermeasure: Fast automatic reconfiguration of new ansible server with Vagrant, Ansible playbooks with server configurations stored in remote git repository

Threat: Employees: Disgruntled or manipulated administrator abuses privileges. Uses SSH keys to compromise other machines; intentionally misconfigures servers
Countermeasure: Background checks for high-privilege system administrators

Threat: Independent contractors: Physical access of datacenter maintainers, obtaining SSH keys or server config files from memory dump; theft of hard disks
Countermeasure:
SSH key material protected by passphrases.

Countermeasures listed above for hardware failure are effective against disk theft as well.

Threat: Organized Crime: Ransomware for financial gains through blackmailing, spreading from the config server to infrastructure
Countermeasure:
Specially hardened server, firewall, only SSH port publicly available, system administrators are reminded by apticron to keep software up to date; passphrases protect SSH keys, preventing direct access to other servers.

Countermeasures listed above for hardware failure are effective against loss of disks access through encryption as well.

Threat: Skilled Hackers: Gains access to config server, installs keylogger to obtain passphrases of system administrators, compromises whole infrastructure
Countermeasure: Specially hardened server, firewall, only SSH port publicly available, system administrators are reminded by apticron to keep software up to date, automatic scan for rootkits using rkhunter.
Additional Countermeasures: Setting up a sophisticated intrusion detection system would decrease the chance of undetected compromise.
